newsitem.title: USA: US W.COAST SPOT PRODUCTS FIRM WITH STRONG NYMEX - AUG 13.
newsitem.headline: US W.COAST SPOT PRODUCTS FIRM WITH STRONG NYMEX - AUG 13.

text.p: Prices for U.S. West Coast refined petroleum products firmed Wedneday, in line with gains in other markets, traders said.
CARB gasoline spot prices, which reflect what dealers charge at the pipeline, rose about two cents a gallon in California to betweem 76 and 77 cents a gallon.
Local markets got a lift from a rally in futures prices, which closed a sharp 2.37 cents a gallon higher on the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX).
Prices also rose after weekly data showed Tuesday showed a slight drop in West Coast gasoline inventories, according to the American Petroleum Institute (API).
Conventional unleaded gasoline prices were up in line with CARB and distillates also rose about one cent.
